channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: Double Cosmic Explosion Gives Birth to Unprecedented ‘Superkilonova’
item.description: In a strange turn of events, a supernova birthed twin baby neutron stars that merged to make a powerful kilonova.

item.title: Gear News of the Week: LG Debuts an RGB LED TV, and Google Brings Find Hub to Wear OS
item.description: Plus: Samsung also announces new Micro RGB TVs, and a looming global memory crunch might make Nvidia reduce its supply of graphics cards.

item.title: 7 Useful Tips for Anyone Connecting to Public Wi-Fi
item.description: Our public spaces are now awash with wireless internet. Make sure you’re getting the most out of every connection.

item.title: The sold-out Nex Playground made my kids laugh and cry
item.description: If you told me last year the Nex Playground would outsell Microsoft's Xbox, even for two weeks, I would have laughed my way out of the room. It's a three-inch cube of a game console that's likely less powerful than your phone, one which uses a single camera to track your body. It only plays […]

item.title: Five post-incident improvements that actually strengthen resilience
item.description: When a major incident hits, the focus naturally turns to restoration. Yet the real test comes afterwards. What can be learned from past failings?

item.title: I'm a recording musician, and the Beyerdynamic DT990 Pro headphones are the audio Christmas gift I've bought for myself
item.description: Beyerdynamic's DT990 Pro are great studio headphones with exceptional comfort and an open-back design

item.title: 5 top CMOs dish on 2025, how they’re preparing for 2026
item.description: Hear directly from the world class CMOs at McDonald’s, State Farm, Kraft Heinz, Hinge, and Crayola on how they survived ’25 and will click in ’26. Never before has the CMO position been more complex—or more essential to driving business results. The mark of success for any chief marketing officer is their impact on the long-term trajectory of a beloved brand. ...

item.title: New Year’s resolutions don’t work: Try this bingo card instead
item.description: Rather than setting yourself up to fail with yet another audacious goal you’ll have bailed on by February, have a go at these strategies. There’s something incredibly compelling about a brand-new year. A fresh start beckons, with each day untroubled by your past decisions. Whatever mistakes you made in 2025 are old news. They were sooo last year. You’re a new person now with new priorities, new habits, and new strategies. It’s in this spirit of new-leaf-turning-over that nearly a third of American adults—and almost half of 18- to 29-year-olds—decide to make New Year’s resolutions for the comin...

item.title: This $27 homebuilder says the Feds are cooking up something big to ‘address’ housing market affordability
item.description: Lennar co-CEO Stuart Miller says major homebuilders are in discussions with the Trump administration: ‘Do I think that something will come out in 2026? I’d be surprised if something isn’t done.’ Want more housing market stories from Lance Lambert’s ResiClub in your inbox? Subscribe to the ResiClub newsletter.

item.title: Hausse des prix, délais rallongés et pénurie : tout ce qu’il faut comprendre de la crise de la RAM
item.description: Vous entendez partout sans peut-être réellement comprendre les enjeux. La mémoire RAM s'arrache à prix d'or en ce moment et certains acteurs délaissent même le marché grand public. Une situation qui concerne en premier lieu les PC, mais pourrait par capillarité atteindre tous les produits tech. On vous explique tout ce que vous devez savoir à propos de la crise de la RAM. ...

item.title: La voiture PlayStation arrive en 2026, mais avec une contrainte technique absurde
item.description: Sony cherche désespérément à se différencier de Tesla et des constructeurs chinois. Sa solution ? Transformer l'habitacle de sa voiture électrique, l'Afeela 1, en salle de jeu roulante. Mais attention aux petits caractères : pour jouer à vos titres PS5, il faudra impérativement une connexion 5G solide.

item.title: Pour Noël, le performant Xiaomi 15T Pro se retrouve avec une solide enceinte Bluetooth dans un pack qui perd plus de 100 €
item.description: Si vous cherchez le cadeau de Noël de dernière minute pour quelqu’un qui a besoin d’un smartphone performant, inutile de tourner autour du sapin : le Xiaomi 15T Pro fait le job. Un téléphone solide, livré ici en bundle avec une enceinte Bluetooth. L’ensemble s’affiche à 803 euros au lieu de 952 euros chez Darty et sur la Fnac, avec une livraison qui arrive avant Noël. ...

item.title: 15+ eco-friendly gifts that someone would actually use
item.description: Shop useful sustainable gift ideas, from clothes made from recycled bottles to reusable versions of disposable things they use every day.

item.title: The Best Gifts for Sleep, as Tested by Our Team
item.description: Sleep is the one thing every giftee needs, and you can help them get it. These are our tried-and-tested picks for giftable sleep aids, from masks to melatonin.

item.title: Pour éviter de faire flamber le prix du Galaxy Z Flip 8, Samsung aurait trouvé un début de solution
item.description: Selon des sources industrielles, la nouvelle puce Exynos 2600 pourrait équiper le Galaxy Z Flip 8 attendu cet été. Une manière pour Samsug de mieux maîtriser ses coûts matériels, alors qu’une crise de la mémoire et du stockage risquent de faire flamber les prix en 2026.

item.title: Last minute holiday shopping this weekend? Here’s how to stay safe from scams
item.description: Stay safe this Christmas - be on the lookout for these scams.

item.title: Apple’s 3 biggest wins and 3 greatest failures of 2025
item.description: From iPhones to AI to a cumbersome headset, these were Apple’s hits and misses this year. The tech industry has endured another turbulent year, buffeted by the continued rise of artificial intelligence and the economic threats posed by President Donald Trump’s tariffs. Even the most prominent companies encountered challenges they never imagined they’d have to face. As 2025 comes to a close, here are Apple’s biggest wins and greatest failures of the year....

item.title: This brilliant free website makes Wikipedia infinitely better
item.description: No exaggeration: You’ll never look at Wikipedia the same way again. Have you ever tried quickly looking something up on Wikipedia—just because you’re curious or maybe for work—only to, a half an hour later, wonder why you’re reading about the history of the European Space Agency?

item.title: Meet Google Maps’s new intelligent planning companion
item.description: This free trip-planning supplement helps you find all sorts of interesting stops along whatever route you’re taking. Planning to hit the road this holiday season? Or maybe just thinking about an extended drive of some sort for sometime in the new year?

item.title: AI slop is killing the internet
item.description: AI slop. It’s just…everywhere. Swipe through your FYP, your Reels, your timeline, and you’ll see slop on slop. Mashable's Associate Editor Tim Marcin explains how we got here.

item.title: Kids arent learning to spell anymore
item.description: If your child struggles to spell, they're not alone. Here's what to do.

item.title: NASAs Hubble saw fledgling planets colliding around a nearby star
item.description: NASA's Hubble telescope saw two cosmic collisions around a nearby star like those theorized to have occurred long ago in our solar system.

item.title: Why your kid cant rely on tech tools to spell
item.description: Google Docs, Grammarly, and ChatGPT can fix mistakes, but the technology masks a serious problem.
